fields.title: Room To Rant
fields.content:
Room to Rant is a space for young men to rap and get stuff off their chest.

The rap and spoken word initiative that tackles men’s mental health is in action across Brighton, Worthing, Crawley, Eastbourne and online. 

The rap sessions are led by highly-experienced and accomplished rappers who are well respected in the  Brighton hip-hop and music scene. Members are encouraged to be themselves; talking and exploring struggles and life experiences through spoken word, rap and hip hop.   

No prior rapping experience is needed at these relaxed, free-to-attend, weekly drop-ins, where young men build on lyric-writing and improvisation skills. The groups can still meet despite Covid-19 and there is one online group for those who can’t meet in-person. Anyone who identifies as male or non-binary aged 16-25  is welcome to attend Room To Rant.
fields.excerpt: Mondays, 1800 till 2100. Free

fields.title: Beginners Chair Yoga
fields.content:
Ashley from Lotus Lessons will support you through a gentle chair based practice that is focused on mindful movement and meditation.

Sessions are accessible for all with modifications given where needed.
fields.excerpt: Beginners Yoga - Weekly £10 Thur 1pm-12pm

fields.title: Acoustic Adele
fields.content: The Original Adele Tribute Show, performed by Helen Ward-Jackson has wowed audiences all over the world, recreating the real Adele experience, with mannerisms, vocals and of course her cheeky down to earth humour. Award winning hits from albums 19,21,25 will be performed throughout the show some include Hello, Chasing Pavements, Skyfall, Rolling in the Deep and many more.
fields.excerpt:
Tickets £14.00 (plus booking fee).

Book tickets through Online Ticket Seller, or in venue.

fields.title: Quiz with Ginja Ninja
fields.content: Join us for a quiz like no other, hosted inside our beautiful venue by our very own bar manager Ross 'Ginja Ninja' Smith. Drinks, laughs and prizes to be won.
fields.excerpt: £2 per person to play, max 6 per team. Please email ross@printersplayhouse.co.uk to ‘book your bubble’.

fields.title: SUS
fields.content: Set on the eve of the Thatcher victory in 1979. The sus laws made it legal for police to stop and search anyone – purely on suspicion. Election night 1979. Two detectives on the graveyard shift in an East London police station place bets on which party will win. Delroy is brought in ‘on suspicion’. The interrogation takes all night. The country wakes up to a new Conservative government. Sus is a powerful and politicised cry against the still-current threat of institutional racism. Keeffe pulls no punches with his depiction of a corrupt world which looks all too familiar today.
fields.excerpt:
Tickets £14.00 (plus booking fee).

Book tickets through Online Ticket Seller, or in venue.

fields.title: American Wilderness Odyssey
fields.content:
American Wilderness Odyssey by Steve Bonham & the Long Road
Friday 8th October   Concert: American Wilderness Odyssey 7.30 pm.  The Playhouse.  Tickets £7
9.30 pm  Downstairs.  Steven Bonham and the Long Road
The Long Road were formed with a single mad idea to go back to the source to explore and reimagine what might grow out of the great musical roots of USA.  The band call it Moonshine Music: taking a few simple, authentic ingredients adding a little heat and magic to try to conjure up some rare, raw spirit to form into an American Wilderness Odyssey... 
Featuring as fine a bunch of rogues as ever hit a recording studio or a dirt stage.  Steve Bonham, a songwriter working in American Folk/Country (guitar, slide, mandolin and guitar/bazouki ); Chris ‘The Bishop’ Lydon on piano channelling swampy New Orleans piano, and ‘The Big Man’ Kev Moore with 40 years of rock’n’roll on bass, guitar and drums.
fields.excerpt:
Tickets £7.00 (plus booking fee).

Book tickets through Online Ticket Seller, or in venue.

fields.title: Troubadours! Pepe Belmonte
fields.content:
Troubadours!  Our monthly roots and acoustic night in the Playhouse!  
Pepe Belmonte, supported by Danny Goring
The Playhouse.  8 pm
Tickets £8 from www.onlineticketseller.com

Pepe Belmonte is singer songwriter working within the blues and roots. He grew up in Co. Cork on the West coast of Ireland. His musical influence meanders through Irish, Malian and Hawaiian folk to the pre-war blues of Chicago along The Delta and down through the lyrical landscape of Dylan, Mitchell and Young. Music from his debut album 'THE HERMIT'S WALTZ' (2012) make up the soundtrack to the independent feature film, 'The Hour of Living' in which Pepe also appears as 'The Singer'. 
A near fatal bicycle accident in 2011 slowed plans for touring and releasing new material. Throughout this imposed hiatus, Pepe continued to work; writing and recording his second full band studio album, 'What Once Was'; publishing a small book, 'Poems/ Prose/ Pictures'; written and performed music for the acclaimed independent feature, 'O' Beautiful Night'; released 2 live albums including 'Live at The Royal Albert Hall' and 'Live at the Jenny'; and has performed live sporadically both solo and with a full band. He is currently recording his third studio album.
fields.excerpt:
Tickets £8.00 (plus booking fee).

Book tickets through Online Ticket Seller, or in venue.

fields.title: Troubadours!  Naomi Bedford and Paul Simmonds
fields.content:
Troubadours! Our monthly roots and acoustic night in the Playhouse!  Tickets £8 

Naomi Bedford and Paul Simmonds are a duo, based in the folk and country roots genre.
They have made 4 acclaimed albums and been nominated for a Radio 2 Folk Award ( Best Original Song). They tour widely and have appeared at Cambridge Festival, Glastonbury, Celtic Connections and many others. Their last album (2019)  ‘Singing It All Back Home’, an album of Appalachian Ballads, originating in England and Scotland, was featured as the Guardian Album of the Month. Playing songs from the same album they were also featured in session on the Mark Radcliffe  BBC Radio 2 show. 

Paul is also the chief songwriter with legendary folk rock band The Men They Couldn’t Hang; his songs have featured in films, TV, radio and in academic resources. 
Naomi has co written and sung on ‘Funny Break’, a Top 20 hit with Orbital and has appeared on Later with Jools Holland.

"Amazing, Naomi pulls no punches" Iggy Pop
"Naomi is the best singer of Appalachian ballads that I know" Shirley Collins
Folk Album of the month - The Guardian June 2019

Supported by Tim Hoyte
fields.excerpt:
Tickets £8.00 (plus booking fee).

Book tickets through Online Ticket Seller, or in venue.

fields.title: Happenings
fields.content:
In these tough times, Life’s a struggle. There’s unfulfilled expectations. Humdrum existences needing an injection of life. Millions wishing something, would happen to them, to fill the void in their lives. Clearly everyone “else” is happy. Online celebrations and holiday pics prove it. Jane can’t take it anymore. She needs that something, anything! but how far is she willing to go to get it?

If you purchased a ticket or tickets for the original run of Happenings at the Grove in December 2020, but were unable to attend on account of being resident in a then-Tier 3 or 4 area, you may exchange your ticket(s) for either of these two performances. Please contact us at grovetheatreeastbourne@gmail.com for your exchange to be processed. This does not apply to those who received refunds on their tickets.
fields.excerpt: Printers at the Grove, a new play by John Berry

fields.title: Christmas Community Play Meeting
fields.content: Come along to the first meeting for the 2021 PPH Christmas Community Play. Everybody is welcome to join us for a fun planning and info session where you’ll find out all about the show and the roles both on and off stage up for grabs.
fields.excerpt: 7pm till 9pm

fields.title: Ukulele Army
fields.content: Fancy something a little different, why not try learning the ukulele. All welcome once again to play along and/or watch the from 7.30pm
fields.excerpt: £3 to take part. Free to watch.

fields.title: Fly Half
fields.content: Fly Half is a new play by Gary Lagden, with original songs by Gareth Moulton that tells the story of a rugby playing steelworker from South Wales. A lyrical hymn to one man’s passion for his family, his town and his beloved game of rugby. Set in an industrial town, this play is a celebration of working class families who head out to the game each week, stand pitch side with pride, supporting their local grassroots team. Fly Half is a story of love, loss, community and sport, that rages against the beige of modern life.
fields.excerpt:
Tickets £14.00 (plus booking fee).

Book tickets through Online Ticket Seller, or in venue.

fields.content:
Improvisation is a skill used in all walks of life to build confidence, free the imagination and improve communication. It's also a huge amount of fun. 
Join us for our inclusive, accessible, *failure free* environment for games, exercises and challenges 
led by actor/director Florence Bell.
fields.excerpt:
£60 6 week course Sept 28th 
Tuesdays at 12.30 - 2.30pm & 6.30 - 8.30pm 

Email us to book: info@printersplayhouse.co.uk

fields.title: Weekend Film Acting Experience
fields.content:
Intensive film acting workshop. An insight into what film acting is, to listen and react and behave truthfully in front of the camera scene and character work - what it means to make the role a version of you. 

Guided by an experienced working film actor: Stevenicolson.com

£175 / Early booking £150 - 10.30am to 5.30pm 
Saturday 23rd & Sunday 24th October

Email us to book: info@printersplayhouse.co.uk

fields.title: Quiz
fields.content:
Our wildly successful Quiz in the Dark as moved to a permanent spot inside on a Sunday night...

...Join us for a quiz like no other, now hosted inside our beautiful venue by our very own bar manager Ross the 'Ginja Ninja' Smith. 

Drinks, laughs and prizes to be won.

Email us to book your team: info@printersplayhouse.co.uk
fields.excerpt: £2 per person to play, max 6 per team. Ticket MUST be booked in advance.

fields.title: Ajay Srivastas
fields.content:
Ajay Srivastav - Indian Folk meets the Blues!  
Saturday 16th October.  8 pm.  Concert in the Playhouse; and in the Stage Bar later..  
Tickets  £7 from www.onlineticketseller.com 

Ajay Srivastav is a London based singer songwriter whose laid-back style transcends musical borders with a sound that flows from the banks of Delta Blues which influenced him as a child to the sacred river of the Ganges where he learnt raags from the Gurus in his father’s hometown of Varanasi – the holy city of India. Blending these influences, he came back with what he calls Karmic Blues.As a musician Ajay has worked with artists as diverse as Jamiroqua, Gregory Isaacs, Zakir Hussain and Bollywood legend Shah Rukh Khan. His songs caught the attention of British music legend Jah wobble who invited him into the studio to develop his material. Ajay has had Top 10 chart success with his Hindi language solo album in India and on iTunes with his world music band Botown. Ajay has performed internationally from live venues such as the Jazz Cafe and the Queen Elizabeth Hall to festivals like Roskilde Dam Square and WOMAD. He is also an accomplished composer for the stage and screen with a musical in development.
Ajay's music is raw, passionate and uplifting - welcome to 'karmic' blues.
fields.excerpt:
Tickets £7.00 (plus booking fee).

Book tickets through Online Ticket Seller, or in venue.

fields.title: The Lost Trades + Tomorrow Bird
fields.content:
Printers Playhouse is delighted to present a double bill of new music featuring Folk/Americana artists The Lost Trades and Tomorrow Bird. The Lost Trades are a trio of Wiltshire based singer songwriters (Jamie R Hawkins, Phil Cooper and Tamsin Quin) who, brought together by a mutual love of folk and roots music, have joined forces for a three part harmony, modern folk adventure. 
Tomorrow Bird is a British acoustic duo comprising of solo artist Jen Bird and Simon Driscoll from the folk- rock band, Burnt Tomorrow. Drawing influences from bands such as The Civil Wars, their haunting melodies and heart-felt lyrics have transfixed audiences and marked them out as a band to watch! The concert starts at 7.30 pm.  Tickets £7
fields.excerpt:
Tickets £7.00 (plus booking fee).

Book tickets through Online Ticket Seller, or in venue.

fields.content:
The Printers Playhouse Community Choir are back in the room... At The Grove Theatre... 

Come and enjoy an evening of uplifting singing with our wonderful choir singing the songs they rehearsed on zoom and can now bring to the room.

7.30pm Fri 10th & Sat 11th Sept
Tickets £13/£11 (plus booking fee)

fields.title: The Pilgrim Mothers
fields.content:
The Pilgrim Mothers are a five-piece musical collective from the South Coast of England, where the waves crash and the seabirds fly. We make vintage, rootsy, folky, soulful sounds and play brand new original songs about life, love and longing - as well as eclectic covers including songs by Tom Waits, Van Morrison, vintage gospel, blues and wartime tunes. Celebrating the past, singing for a better now.

To book a table please email info@printersplayhouse.co.uk
fields.excerpt: Starts at 8:30pm. Free
